MVP and four-time scoring champion plans to play in his 11th straight All-Star game Feb. 14 at Cowboys Stadium. "My fans still support me. You can't ask for more than that," he said. When you play this game, it's all about the people that come to see you, the people in the stands. For somebody to say the fans don't mean anything, that's crazy. Since joining the team in early December, Allen Iverson has helped the 76ers go 10-13 after a 5-15 start. He entered Saturday averaging 14.2 points, well below his career average, and 4.3 assists. the Fiat chief backing away from his previous remarks in a telephone conversation with labour minister Maurizio Sacconi . According to the ministry, Sergio Marchionne explained that he spoke in "hypothetical" terms and that nothing was decided, with no reference about a new location for the company's leadership for today or tomorrow. by a new jazz artist internationally in 2008. The highly acclaimed release was the first opportunity for a worldwide audience to witness her mesmerizing talents as an instrumentalist, vocalist and composer. The New York Times raved, Esperanza Spalding has got a lot: accomplished jazz improvisation, funk, scat singing, Brazilian vernacular rhythm and vocals in English, Portuguese and Spanish. At its center is a female bassist, singer and bandleader, one whose talent is beyond question. Soon after release, Esperanza Spalding went straight to the top of Billboard's Contemporary Jazz chart where it remained for over 70 weeks. While Philadelphia remained 2 1/2 games behind Boston in the Atlantic Division, Chris Webber gave a glimpse of what he could contribute down the stretch. " James May think every little bit helps your confidence," Chris Webber said. One day you're averaging a number that many people don't do in three categories and the next day you're worthless. And that's from myself, James May don't even care what everyone else is saying. Allen Iverson , who had nine assists, knew Chris Webber was trying too hard to meet monstrous expectations. . While The X Factor creator said "it's impossible to predict" how the British format will fare with American viewers, he feels there is a key to making the show successful. The most important thing is I know that you got to make a show which is different to what your competitors are doing. It has to be well made, it has to be controversial, interesting, and if the U.S. show has some of the same qualities as what we've done in the UK, then I think it could do really really well, Simon Cowell told reporters.
